newsitem.title: JAPAN: JR East strengthens on firm earnings.
newsitem.headline: JR East strengthens on firm earnings.

text.p: East Japan Railway Co (JR East) shares strengthened in Thursday morning trade as investors bought the shares encouraged by its firm earnings, brokers said.
At the lunch break, the shares were up 8,000 yen at 583,000.
"JR East earnings were better than expected and foreign investors have been keeping up a steady stream of buying," a broker at a medium-sized brokerage said.
JR East said earlier that its group current profit for the year to March 31, 1997, was 119.04 billion yen, compared with 114.68 billion yen in the previous year.
